etymology.description: A horizontal stroke representing the concept of 'one'.
etymology.interpretation: The character 一(yī, "one") is a simple horizontal line signifying the singular and unified concept of 'one'. It directly represents being singular or the number one.

examples.chinese: 我有一个苹果(我有一個蘋果)。
他只看到一只鸟(他只看到一隻鳥)，飞进了花园(飛進了花園)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǐ kàn dào yī zhī niǎo, fēi jìn le huā yuán.
examples.english: He only saw one bird, which flew into the garden.

examples.chinese: 一条直路通向远方(一條直路通向遠方)。
examples.pinyin: Yī tiáo zhí lù tōng xiàng yuǎn fāng.
examples.english: One straight road leads to the distance.
